title: The rights you might not realize you have - Shannon Odell

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason for the recent movement of young plaintiffs suing their governments for inaction on tackling climate change?

options.label: A
options.text: Economic losses due to climate change.

options.label: B
options.text: Human rights violations, specifically the right to a healthy environment.

options.label: C
options.text: Lack of access to clean air and water.

options.label: D
options.text: Failure to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

multiple-choice.question: What document was adopted by the United Nations in 1948, outlining human rights?

options.label: A
options.text: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR).

options.label: B
options.text: The Paris Agreement.

options.label: C
options.text: The Kyoto Protocol.

options.label: D
options.text: The Copenhagen Accord.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a non-binding document that outlines human rights.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a binding treaty that outlines human rights.

options.label: C
options.text: It established rights like freedom of thought, political liberties, and socioeconomic and cultural rights.

options.label: D
options.text: It only outlines economic rights.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason for the recognition of the right to a healthy environment?

options.label: A
options.text: To protect biodiversity and ecosystems.

options.label: B
options.text: To address human rights violations.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase economic growth.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Colombian Supreme Court ruling in favor of the young plaintiffs in 2018?

options.label: A
options.text: It established the right to a healthy environment as a binding treaty.

options.label: B
options.text: It recognized the right to a healthy environment as a human right.

options.label: C
options.text: It found that the government was legally obliged to reduce deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions.

options.label: D
options.text: It only addressed economic losses due to climate change.

multiple-choice.question: What is the current status of human rights-based environmental cases worldwide?

options.label: A
options.text: Over 100 countries have enshrined the right to a healthy environment into national legislation.

options.label: B
options.text: Over 150 countries have enshrined the right to a healthy environment into national legislation.

options.label: C
options.text: Over 200 countries have enshrined the right to a healthy environment into national legislation.

options.label: D
options.text: Over 2,000 human rights-based environmental cases have been filed across the globe.

options.label: B
options.text: It recognized the right to a healthy environment as a human right.

options.label: C
options.text: It acknowledged the importance of protecting biodiversity and ecosystems.

options.label: D
options.text: It only addressed economic losses due to climate change.
